content.question: The figure shows the net force exerted on the satellite by the moon and the direction of the tangential velocity of the satellite at time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true regarding the motion of the satellite?

choices.label: The gravitational force exerted on the satellite by the moon will increase after time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The satellite accelerates in a direction that is parallel to the direction of the tangential velocity.

The satellite will move toward the moon after time <math alttext="t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The tangential velocity of the satellite does not remain constant.

content.answer: The tangential velocity of the satellite does not remain constant.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
